item.title: About us
item.dc:creator: energycheetah
item.content:encoded:
We are three computer science students at DHBW Karlsruhe, Germany and started our studies in Oct. 2015. The roles in our team we defined using the RUP terminology.
  • Project Manager - Sara
  • Tester/Test Designer - Lior
  • Implementer - Damian, Lior
  • Tool Specialist - Damian
  • Designer - Damian, Lior and Sara
If you have any improvements, ideas or wishes please feel free to contact us.
item.excerpt:encoded: Dies ist nur eine Kurzfassung der Seite&nbsp;„Über“.

item.title: Project Vision
item.dc:creator: energycheetah
item.content:encoded:
As students we face often the problem to get properly prepared for the tests. Using formerly  test is essential to succeed. With our "Cheetah" webapplication students can upload/write test and solutions they memorize or documents they used to learn for the test. Collected documents will be categorized by institute, professor and course. The webapplication should include:
  • user login
  • ability for users to add schools, professors and courses
  • upload and view of pictures and PDFs
  • create text files directly in the application
  • paint function
  • search function
  • comment function
  • report of abuse function
  • camera integration for smartphones
  • user conversations
We hope out "Cheetah" Project helps us and many students to enhance our/their grades. Damian, Lior und Sara

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: We really like your idea, it sound well structured. We think it will be useful for future learning (especially for us stutents ;) ) Does your idea include tests and exams? If yes, did you think about access restriction?

hi there,
i got a good first impression from your project. your readers can clearly figure out what the vision of your project is! you also have a nice website, looking forward to hear more from you guys!
regards, andreas
That's a great idea! I especially like the idea of creating different rooms for profs and schools. It makes it easier for students to get access to old tests without having to ask older students.
[…] Project Vision – blog post […]

item.title: Team roles
item.dc:creator: energycheetah
item.content:encoded:
To give you more details on our project and who does what, based on the RUP terminology, check out our About us page. Technologies:
  • Ruby on Rails
  • Jira
  • Github
  • Bootstrap
  • Microsoft Project
  • MySQL Database

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Hi there, thank you for the insight into your team. I the roles are clearly defined.I hope you us updated about changes of techology.
Greetings from JoinSports
Hi! All clear, but maybe you could introduce (just a bit) yourselves :). And I like to see photos, but maybe this is more personal. Good luck!
[…] Team Roles – blog post […]

item.title: Software Requirements Specification
item.dc:creator: energycheetah
item.content:encoded: With this post we present you our Software Requirements Specification and the Overall Use-Case Diagram. Software Requirements Specification Overall Use-Case Diagram

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi Team Cheetah, I think your SRS is really well done. I have one question though, it seems to me that the hyper-links in ur your PDF are not working. Maybe you can check this out.

Hi there,
We checked your SRS and everything seems to be fine. The points are described fine allthough there are many points which dont apply to your project. The use case diagramm is also nice and easy to understand.
Regards and keep going!
Team Project Ortus

item.title: Use Cases
item.dc:creator: energycheetah
item.content:encoded: Today we present you our Use Cases with the Activity Diagram and the Mock Up. Use Case - Log in Use Case - Create Text Use Case - Add University Use Case - Add Course Use Case - Add Lecturer We also linked it from our Software Requirements Specification. Greetings, Team Cheetah

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Hi Cheetah,
Your Use Cases are pretty easy to understand and follow. A Quick Look at your Mockups is enough to understand in within the blink of an eye what your tool is all about.
We look forward to prepare ourselfs for exams with your tool!
Regards From Team Project Ortus

Hello Team Cheetah, your usecases have got everything they need. You have nice mockups and pretty unterstandable diagrams. You even got the links to the SRS. The only thing we do not clearly see are the CRUDs.
Kind regards TheMidnightExpress

Hey Team Cheetah,
I just discovered this new blog entry about your Uses Cases. The Use Cases seem to cover all necessary requirements and constraints. It is also easy to understand, especially if you take a look on the Mockups.
But I can imagine that you could face some problems with your Use Case 'Add Institution'. If your Controller only checks if the name of the new institution already exists in the database, it would be possible to add our university twice for example as 'DHBW Karlsruhe' or 'Duale Hochschule Karlsruhe'. I think this will only be done by mystake and so it isn't a real issue but I just noticed that and wanted to let you know.
Regards
Patrick, Team vnv

Hi,
your updated SRS looks nice. The use case about the create text is clearly structured and easy to understand. Also the mockups are enough to see how it should be designed later on. The use case about the add institution is also very clearly structured but I am missing the postcondition of an error (like shown in the activity diagramm).
We look forward to see this project in the future.
Regards from team JoinSports

item.title: Jira
item.dc:creator: energycheetah
item.content:encoded: Today we link to our Jira project Cheetah. (You'll need to have a user account) You will always be able to see our status, what we have accomplished and what still needs to be done. Cheers, Team Cheetah

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Hey CHEETAH Team Your Sprints look great and realy detailed. Also nice to see that you allready started completing the tasks.
Best regards BillChill
Thank you :)

Hey there, I can just agree with BillChill, your Sprint looks structured and well-conceived!
Best regards AnKaLu

Hi CHEETAH Team,
the Sprint are pretty detailed. We don't know what to brag about. Looks cool!
Best regards
Team Ortus

Hey Team Cheetah, your issues and sprints look well explained and detailed. Congratulations that you already completed a lot of these.
Kind regards TheMidnightExpress

item.title: Cucumber
item.dc:creator: energycheetah
item.content:encoded: Today we present to you our Cucumber test for the Login Usecase. The other Usecases will be  updated soon. Cheers, Cheetah

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Hey there,
your feature file seems to work properly, good job! But I would recommend putting additional scenarios like a successful login to it.
Best regards AnKaLu
Thank you, we will update it soon :)

Hi, your feature file looks very good and detailed. Actually I have nothing to complain. Keep up the good work!
Best regards BillChill
Hey Team Cheetah, your feature file looks goog. What tool are you using to execute those feature steps? Selenium or something different? Best regards, Team JoinSports
We used Selenium, but there is a problem with it. We didn't find a solution yet.

Hello Cheetah,
your test scenario and the usecase are looking good. Some additional usecases would be great!
Kind regards TheMidnightExpress

item.title: UML Class-Diagram
item.dc:creator: energycheetah
item.content:encoded: Today we want to present our Class-Diagram that we created using the rubymine IDE. Sadly the attributes are not shown, all thought they had been created: For a better view click here. For that reason we generated it from the mysql Database: For better view look here. Update - we created now with another plugin from ruby the class diagram. Click here to watch it. Cheers :)

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Hey Team Cheetah,
as you mentioned, it is sad that your IDE doesn't show the attributes. Anyways, your export from the mySQL Database looks very structured and well organized. Maybe you find a way to add some methods.
Keep it up!
Regards, Patrick, Team vnv
Thank you, will keep you updated :)

Hey Cheetah,
your diagrams look really great, but maybe you should put in a bigger picture of your first diagram... It is not readable at all.
The MySQL Diagramm looks nicely structured.
Greetings Textventurer

Hi Team Cheetah,
your UML looks pretty nice. To bad, the attributes are not shown.
Regards
Team Ortus
Thanks, we will put a link in it..
Thanks for your comment, we'll keep trying to fix this.

Hello Team-Cheetah,
we really like your diagramms. The mysql databases looks well thought out.
Kind regards TheMidnightExpress
[…] UML Class Diagram – blog post […]

item.title: Software Architecture Document
item.dc:creator: energycheetah
item.content:encoded: Hi, this week we made our Software Architecture Document. Click here to see it. Cheers!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
hello team cheetah,
your SAD. looks clean and organized, you mentioned your framework and it contains all the necessary graphics. thats a nice SAD.
regards, TheMidnightExpress

Hi there
your SAD looks pretty good and you fulfilled the given grading criteria. We are just wondering why you put in two Model diagrams.
lovely greetings <3
GTA-Group

item.title: MS Project
item.dc:creator: energycheetah
item.content:encoded: Today we show you our Gantt Chart in the long term Project Management tool MS Project. Please click here. Cheers!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Hi guys. Great job! Your Gant-Diagramm looks nicely detailed and structured. The only disadvantage is that you need to download the document in order to view the chart.
Really nice job!
Kind regards GTA Group❤

Hey energycheetah,
your gantt chart is pretty good prepared, good job!
Greets BillChill

Hey
your gantt chart is pretty good stuctured but we got a few ideas how to impove it. First of all the team member names are cut off the resources. Also there are missing some points in the future (remember long term plan). Thank you for your work,
Regards JoinSports
Thanks for your feedback.. Still we made our plan till midterm.. In three month there is more to plan

item.title: Risk Management
item.dc:creator: energycheetah
item.content:encoded: Today we made our risk management. In following you can see a screenshot of it: You can find the updated version as excel here.   UC Estimation (for next week): All our updated Use Cases you can find here. In the following you can see our time estimation for all UC until now (not all is done yet): Here you can find the updated version. For the overview for this semester we present here our overall diagram: Have fun, Cheetah

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Hello Team Cheetah!
I just discovered this new blog entry about your risks and uc estimation. I think alle the important risks are covered and the risk mitigation strategy seems to make sense.
The time estimation for your use cases still seems to be uncomplete. But I guess you will finish this soon.
Keep up the good work!
Cheers, vnv

Hey guys,
just stumbled across your blog browsing through Peer Review Central. Our projects have a lot in common, so it was especially interesting for us to see what you've achieved so far. Nice job!
The only thing which left me wondering in your risk management table was the 100% probability of occurrence for quite a list of risks. Are you being very pessimistic about your hardware and experience or did you mean that those have occurred already? This part left me a bit puzzled.
Anyways, I wish you all the best with your project. Keep up the good work and come check out our blog if you want at https://smartifytheworld.wordpress.com/ ;)
Cheers, Danny

hi cheeath, nice to see you back in business again! We also checked your new blog post about risk management and your new use cases.Like VNV said unfortunately there is no real "timetable" when the UCs will be done. The risk management stuff looks fine and can be understood by outstanding people.
Have a good week and see you soon, Andreas - Project Ortus

Hello there,
your Risk management looks complete and well structured. We would recommend you to update the Column of the "Risk Probability of Occurrence", because it looks quite unrealistic if you write 100% in 5 out of 7 cases.
Best regards Team AnKaLu

item.title: Function Point Calculation
item.dc:creator: energycheetah
item.content:encoded: Hi to all, today we present you our function point calculation. We do this to see how long our use cases that aren't done yet will take to finish. Here is the link for the concrete calculation: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1GuAvXTwR3EBxf9bSZ5d9jDknXt4O-wumNrIfMivH_Uo/edit#gid=0

item.title: Function Point Calculation
item.dc:creator: energycheetah
item.content:encoded: Hi everyone, today we present you our function point calculation. This is to see how long the use cases that are left will take to finish. Here the link to the precise Calculation: Function Point Calculation. We also updated our Use Cases: UC - Add Lecturer UC - Add Course UC - Add University UC - Comment Function UC - Create Text UC - Login Here is also our Graph showing velocity:   The yellow points is our estimation for the future Use Cases. The out liner dot is because we had some problems while working on this use case. That's why it took us a bit longer.   Cheers, Cheetah

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Hey Guys!
I would love to take a look at your precise calculation, but it's not publicly viewable...
Even still, the calculation seems fine, as it gave you a nice graph.
Keep it up, TextVenturer

item.title: Test-Plan
item.dc:creator: energycheetah
item.content:encoded: Hey everybody today we present you our Test-Plan. You can find it here. Link to Test Code here. Here the Screenshot of a Test Run in our IDE Ruby Mine. We'll keep you posted :) Cheers, Cheetah

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hey Team Cheetah, you have etablished a good testing environment and proved by screenshot your testfile is running for your first UC. Well done! Try to find Entry/Exit Criteria for your Test Plan and link your build file!

Cheers, Team vnv.

item.content:encoded:
Here we present each of our Repository Links from the Refactoring Task:

  • Lior
  • Sara
Have fun, Cheetah

wp:comment.wp:comment_content:
Hey Team Cheetah,
your Refactoring looks pretty good. Each GitHub has several commits with the name of code smell on it that was changed. Maybe you could add some more tests to guarantee the functionality of your code.
Keep up the good work!
Cheers, Team vnv
